JobTitle: Analyst / Sr Analyst, Prospect Direct Mail Acquisition
JobFullDesc:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
Prospect Direct Mail is a key channel for driving new Cardmembers to American Express. The Sr. Analyst will play an integral part in driving new proprietary lending card acquisitions, leveraging data and advanced segmentation capabilities to make informed decisions and design robust test and learn plans. This is an exciting opportunity for a high-performing candidate who wants to innovate and gain channel ownership.
Working with a Senior Manager on the team, the Senior Analyst will work on the strategy, execution and analysis of proprietary lending direct mail acquisition campaigns. This individual will also play a substantial role in transforming the direct mail channel to maximize efficiency, enhance targeting capabilities and drive bottom line business results. 
Job Responsibilities:

Develop winning creatives, offers, and segmentation to drive higher response and spend. 
Collaborate with key partners to drive flawless execution of Direct Mail campaigns. Due to the complexity of the systems and processes, this person must demonstrate high strengths in organization and attention to detail.
Report & track results.
Draw insight and linkages from multiple sets of data.

Minimum Qualifications:
•    Bachelor’s Degree 
•    Strong project management skills with relentless attention to detail 
•    Ability to multitask, stay organized, and operate effectively under changing or stressful conditions 
•    Proven analytical and problem-solving skills 
•    Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
•    Adeptness for building and leveraging relationships 
•    Positive attitude and commitment to success 
•    Creative thinker with a strong customer focus 
•    Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint and other Microsoft Office suite programs 
•    At least 1-2 years Marketing experience
